description: Heartleaf Madeiravine (Axredera Cordifolia) is an amazing species of fast-growing, semi-erect, flowering vine. It has heart-shaped leaves and stems that can reach up to 10 feet long. Its flowers produce white, small, edible fruits. It's a rust-resistant plant that can make an ideal ground cover in sunny, moist areas. It's also used as an ornamental plant in gardens, planted in-ground or hanging baskets. It can tolerate a range of temperatures and most soil types. It's an amazing choice for landscaping since it's easy to propagate and maintain. Plus, it can bring a bit of cheer to any garden with its showy white flowers that appear almost year-round.
